text: Not a bad place for cup or coffee or latte on a regular day. I would not go out of my way to visit this place but would not mind stopping by again if I am directly or close to this place.

I go to this coffeeshop every time I am in the Manayunk area of Philly. I love their smoked salmon panini. It is very filling and it has a good sauce and bread. The paring with the salad is well thought out. It's a quiet place to study and/or get some emails done. I will be returning here next time I am in the city!

Love this place! This is a staple in Manayunk. Great food, drinks, and awesome employees! The baristas are always so kind and helpful. This is a really great place to do work and the upstairs is pretty quiet as well! This is the best coffee shop in Manayunk!

Best avocado toast I've ever had, hands down. They do NOT skimp on the avocado here. You can have it topped with egg and cream cheese for a protein- rich breakfast, or have it heaped with arugula and other veggies for something lighter and wholesome. The paninis are really generous too!

They serve La Colombe coffee and it's always great. They serve their cappuccinos with lots of foam which I personally really like sometimes. When you can sit inside, it's a sunny, cheerful atmosphere. The staff is very friendly!

I've only gotten an iced tea from here but I really enjoyed it and honestly, I feel like you can judge a place pretty well on how good their plain black iced tea is! The one thing that i've felt the few times i've been here, and both times it was a random weekday and not crowded, was that it wasn't super welcoming. Like I felt very intimidated walking in there. Maybe it's because all of the staff are standing in a row when you walk in and just stare at you? I guess that's sorta the vibe at most coffee shops but still just wanted to note that if you get nervous ordering make sure you look at the menu and decide beforehand.
Love this place. Over the top great grilled cheese sandwich. Excellent cold beet salad. Friendly staff.

The coffee is...coffee (hard to mess that up) and the food is pretty good, the atmosphere is pretty cute as well but the service leaves much to be desired. The staff feels very pretentious and you can sense an air of superiority coming from them when it's obvious you're not used to ordering from a place that isn't Starbucks or Dunkin. On my first visit I ordered a macchiato and was told "You know it's not like a Starbucks macchiato right" which in all fairness is correct but it's the way the message is delivered that makes me uncomfortable. On my second visit I ordered a black coffee because I wasn't comfortable with the looks I was getting from the girl at the corner. As someone that works in the service industry I know what it's like to be busy and understaffed but making guests comfortable should always be a priority right? Even if they are confused about the menu.
Great coffee, good atmosphere, and good prices. A local hotspot!!

Stopped by Volo during our college touring trip through the area, and found Volo based upon very positive Yelp reviews.  It did not disappoint!  

Enjoyed their friendly service, professional and safe COVID protocols, excellent and strong coffee (loved their latte) and some fantastic breakfast sandwiches and pastries.  Enjoyed the experience and would recommend as a 4-star experience.

Don't get me wrong, the coffee here is good! I'm writing and update because I was in here grabbing avocado toast and a few hot beverages for me and friends. I had to throw my toast in the trash. The guys that make the food along with the who I think was the owner were talking while my food was being made not wearing masks and I literally saw spit fly out of one of their mouths. I know I should of asked for my money back, but it was packed and I really don't like making a scene. I don't have an issue with the no mask rules, but after seeing that, I think food workers should permanently wear masks along with the hair nets they wear. 
FYI The ladies making the coffee all had on masks! I did drink my coffee. Lol. It was good.

Great vibe if you are looking for a quite place to read, study, or work? free wifi but not whole lot of outlets! The coffee's half-decent; but hey, most of Americans drink coffee for caffeine, not the taste anyways so why bother? If you are asking if they are acidic, they are not unless you're nursing it.

Service is a little iffy and the woman wasn't being consistent with her mask, but the turkey bacon panini, cold brew coffee, and iced coffee we got were pretty good. 

The coffees here are La Colombe and they also sell La Colombe packs as well.

It was our second time here, and if we're back in the area, we will probably go back for coffee and to split a panini.
Amazing coffee shop right on Main Street. Great coffee and food and kind, speedy service.
Best breakfast sandwiches, excellent coffee, friendly staff - thanks for starting my mornings off right Volo :)

Volo Coffeehouse was super cool and extremely affordable. Very cute spot with great prices and good choices. Cheese Danish was fantastic. I might have a new favorite dish here now. The team are extremely attentive and nice and they're very good at giving recommendations. If you have not tried Volo Coffeehouse you need to at least once.

We are supporters of any La Colombe vendor. This s place seems very popular, apparent by the line down the whole block! They had a great selection of hot and cold coffees with a variety of nondairy milks. We were drawn to the breakfast paninis that were on perfectly crunchy sour dough bread. They also serve lunch which is a plus. Ordering was a little disorganized but we will definitely be coming back for the delicious food and drink - worth the wait.
Super yummy food and great service! I had the orange juice and a sandwich. The staff was really prompt and friendly.

High quality coffee & takes safety seriously during COVID!!

Was very happy with the service here! The line moved quickly, as did my order of coffee and yogurt. The staff takes the pandemic restrictions very seriously which made me feel safe. 

The iced cortado is the next iced coffee imo- perfect balance of coffee to milk and their oat milk gave it a really creamy flavor. Granola was a little sweet for me but it pairs well with the plain Greek yogurt. 

Definitely plan on coming back here for more of their delish coffee!!

SUCH DELICIOUS COFFEE.
Please update your hours- arrived @7 and you currently don't open until 730
Great coffee spot. I love their cappuccinos. They are very friendly and they are pretty quick!
I swear on my mothers grave they have the best avocado toast I have ever had in my entire life and that's no cap

I just had one of the best almond croissants  and caramel macchiatos ever! With so many coffeehouses closed during this Pandemic it was a blessing when I walked pass Volo Coffeehouse and it was open.  The service was fast even though many people waited in line adhering to social distancing guidelines. I got my food and found a near by bench sat and ate, I was in heaven...so delicious!!! I had to go back and tell my server how delicious  everything was and how pleased I was. I am a LOVER of food as well as excellent service!!! I've traveled the world and enjoyed many delightful treats...today's experience was noteworthy for sure!!! Needless to say I'll be back!!!

Volo has been and will always be one of my favorite coffee shops. The coffee has an unbeatable taste, and I like the fact that they have food options. This is where I first ordered a Cortado, and let me tell you, it's definitely worth ordering. Super tasty! They also have incredible customer service, and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I recently moved, (not far away, just not as close) and one of the biggest things that I miss about living in Manayunk, is not being able to wake up and walk down to Volo within 10 minutes. If you haven't paid this little shop a visit, make sure you get around to!

Saw the great reviews on yelp and decided to meet friends here on Sunday morning. The Volo avocado toast was incredible and The other people in my party raved about their food as well. Bathrooms were clean and service was with a smile. Will be back!
The best Manayunk neighborhood coffee shop! La Colombe is a philly staple, and love that they serve a philly brew. Their pastries are amazing, too.

Got the macchiato with caramel and just your average bagel with cream cheese. Coffee was excellent, had great flavor and was strong. Bagel was also fresh and had plenty of spread. My friends had something from every corner of the menu and we were all impressed. Small dining area was pretty crowded for a Tuesday morning...a lot of people taking up tables working on laptops, so just be advised you may not get a seat right away or at all. Would love to come back here!
Cool little shop in the center of Manayunk, lots of coffee, teas, pastries, sandwiches, etc. to choose from. Friendly staff, delicious pastries! Limited seating area. Would return
Went here with a friend for a quick coffee and it was amazing. Got a vanilla latte and a cinnamon bun and both were absolutely delicious.

First time visiting this location. We stopped for a quick breakfast before needing to be somewhere. The cashier had a bit of an attitude and no patience as we didn't know the menu. My brother in law also has a hearing impairment and the cashier just couldn't be bothered with giving a second to interpret what he said. However, the ham breakfast panini was really good and the coffee is very good. I just don't personally care for subpar service.

I genuinely believe I'm not wanted here despite having stopped in a number of times. If I order an iced coffee, and then get charged for, and given an iced americano one more time, I'm going to do nothing except for continue my Volo boycott.

Great coffee shop - strong cold brew, good fresh food selection, and a cozy atmosphere that manages to be intimate without getting too cramped.

There aren't too many outlets to be found around the shop, so just be sure to charge your computer before you head over.

This is my favorite coffee shop in Manayunk and I think I tried most of them. It is very inviting and the service has been friendly every time which is a big deal when deciding if you wanna go back to a place.

The coffee is great and they have delicious baked goods. I haven't tried the sandwiches or breakfast yet but I will definitely be back.

Perfect coffeehouse vibe, great for studying with lots of tables. They have a nice selection of coffees, milks and sandwiches. I got a caramel latte and it was absolutely delicious. The staff are super friendly and helpful.

Hopping place in Manyunk.Every seat was taken and not necessarily with computers attached to humans. The store is surprisingly quiet even with all the customers. The food is meticulously prepared at the counter on the left of the barista. The coffee was very good too. Colombe coffee is used. All was excellet

One of my favorite places to go to for coffee! Their avocado toast and Greek yogurt taste even better than they look!  There's always a short wait whenever I come, whether it's a weekday morning or a weekend afternoon but it goes by quickly. I also always manage to get a table even though the seating area looks crowded. They have outdoor seating as well which is nice and reminds me of Europe, but I've found them to always be taken during warmer months.

While lodged in a nearby Airbnb awaiting a wedding, our 3-member family sought out a nearby diner for breakfast.  Our first choice was closed for a "family emergency," so we settled for the coffee shop across the street.  What a find!

Delicious breakfast selections, excellent coffee, and tasty treats to finish up.  The staff was friendly, efficient, knowledgeable, and welcoming.  But the best aspect was the warm vibe from the other customers both inside and outside.  The tables are positioned to enable you to chat with a neighbor or enjoy your weekend paper in privacy.  It was a delightful experience for all of us.

We enjoyed the morning so completely that we headed back that afternoon for a pre-wedding coffee (and a donut).  And, of course, we returned for a pre-brunch coffee the following morning.  On the way out, we purchased a gift card for the bride and groom.

Good food, reasonable prices, terrific service, comfortable environment, and superb memories.

Very solid coffeehouse with great food options. I didn't order any drinks but my coworkers love their cold brew. Staff is fast and efficient.

Got the egg, cheese, bacon, spinach, and tomato panini. It came out piping hot, crispy and very generous. They didn't skimp any of the ingredients, especially the bacon. Would definitely recommend adding avocado though. The panini was savory and seasoned just right and only $6 for a full size sandwich. Pretty good deal if you ask me (or my California price standards might be all screwed up).
Iced coffee / salmon everything bagel both really good, hate paper straws as they don't work for more than 5 minutes. Super busy place
Great coffee. Fantastic prices. Awesome friendly & community vibe. Crowded, but not in a bad way.

A cute little coffee house, nice for a quick stop. It's a small shop; there isn't much space to sit and/or study, so if you'd be lucky to snag a spot. 

The staff doesn't really try to interact with you past taking your order, but so far in my experience, I haven't encountered a situation in which I'd say they were rude. 

The coffee is a bit on the pricier side and they don't have as many options as some other coffee places in the vicinity. However, the coffee they do have is La Colombe, and it does taste quite nice. 

I'd go to Volo if I needed coffee in a pinch, but other places might be more suitable on a day-to-day basis.
Come early on the weekends to snag a table. Busy place for biking and cars n coffee crowds

Walked in and went to order a coffee, the cashier jumped as if I yelled at her when I said "Excuse me ma'am." Tried to order a sandwich a while back, 35 minutes later I go back to a different cashier, he asked about the exact sandwich I ordered and instead of serving me or apologizing he just asked me if I wanted my money back. No explanation as to why the sandwich was never made. 

I was also the only Black person in the spot.

The most delicious cappuccino I've ever had! Atmosphere encourages conversation instead of perpetuating the antisocial world of other WiFi driven coffeehouses. Patrons go for the coffee and to make friends.
Great coffee beans, great dairy, great atmosphere. I moved to New York 4 years ago, and I think this is still my favorite coffee shop.

Had an unexpected stay nearby when we had a flat tire and stopped in to kill time, and was pleasantly suprised. They had great coffee, some pastry and sandwich options. I custom built an avocado toast and it was probably the best I have ever had. Its on a very cute street in a cute part of town.

Awesome fast service here and friendly staff. Came in for a quick brunch with friends while in town. I got a cinnamon pastry and chocolate stuffed pastry. They were both very yummy and fulfilling. Nice spot to stop for some outdoor seating as well. Plenty of bikers and people with dogs too.

This place is awful. I went in yesterday a small vanilla late cots 6.50 when I asked the worker why it's costs so much he got very snappy with me and said he doesn't make the prices. I said a latte at Starbucks does not cost this much. He rudely said fine go to Starbucks. To say the least I left and did not pay for the drink nor will I ever be back!

Volo is my favorite coffee shop in the area. They serve la Colombe coffee with amazing food and have very friendly staff. Their iced coffee, regular coffee, and lattes are amazing. Their breakfast paninis, lunch paninis, and fresh pastries never disappoint. I recommend the caprese panini and the bacon egg and cheese panini. If you're in the area I'd definitely recommend to stop by.
Love that they dont pre-sweeten their cafe mocha. A rarity. Love that they carry all milk percentages BUT they need to carry ORGANIC dairy. Also $6 for a large cafe is a bit much.

Volo has been my favorite coffee place for a very long time....unfortunately the last two cappuccino drinks have been luke warm before I got in my car!  Hope to see their standards return....disappointed!
